subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Fans, ductwork and duct components that form part of an air-conditioning system or mechanical ventilation system must—

ol.li: separately comply with (2), (3), (4) and (5) to (12); or
achieve a fan motor input power per unit of flowrate lower than the fan motor input power per unit of flowrate achieved when applying (2), (3), (4) and (5) to (12) together.; or

ol.xt:author: Jerome Samuel
ol.li: Fans in systems that have a static pressure of not more than 200 Pa must have an efficiency at the full load operating point not less than the efficiency calculated with the following In MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahCart1ev3aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamysaiaad6 gaaaa@37B8@ R0lGODlhEgASAPAAAP///wAAACwAAAAAEgASAAACI4SPqcvtD4OEKNBjr8lT5vVZIhMCHImd6Iat ZvulXarV9u0UACH/C01hdGhUeXBlMDAxzgUBAAcHRFNNVDcAARNXaW5BbGxCYXNpY0NvZGVQYWdl cwARBVRpbWVzIE5ldyBSb21hbgARA1N5bWJvbAARBUNvdXJpZXIgTmV3ABEETVQgRXh0cmEAEgAI IS9Fj0QvQVD0EA9HX0FQ8h8eQVD0FQ9BAPRF9CX0j0JfQQD0EA9DX0EA9I9F9CpfSPSPQQD0EA9A 9I9Bf0j0EA9BKl9EX0X0X0X0X0EPDAEAAQABAgICAgACAAEBAQADAAEABAAACgEAAgCDSQACAINu AAAAACH/C01hdGhUeXBlMDAz2Dw/eG1sIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMCI/PjwhLS0gTWF0aFR5cGVAVHJh bnNsYXRvckA1QDVATWF0aE1MMiAoQ2xpcGJvYXJkKS50ZGxATWF0aE1MIDIuMCAoQ2xpcGJvYXJk KUAgLS0+PG1hdGggeG1sbnM9J2h0dHA6Ly93d3cudzMub3JnLzE5OTgvTWF0aC9NYXRoTUwnPjxt cm93PjxtaT5JPC9taT48bWk+bjwvbWk+PC9tcm93PjwvbWF0aD48IS0tIE1hdGhUeXBlQEVuZEA1 QDVAIC0tPgAh/wtNYXRoVHlwZTAwMgYEAAAAAAAAOw== = natural logarithm; or

where the electrical input power of the fan at peak efficiency point, including any integrated motor control equipment is greater than 30 kW—
have a peak system static efficiency of not less than 56% for installation type A or C; or
a peak system total efficiency of not less than 56% for installation type B or D.

subclause.xt:author: Jerome Samuel
subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Subject to (5) to (6), fans must either—

ol.xt:author: Jerome Samuel
ol.li: individually, have a fan power ratio in accordance with Specification 46 of less than 0.96; or
collectively, have an average fan power ratio in accordance with Specification 46 of less than 0.96.

subclause.xt:author: Jerome Samuel
subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Where a fan’s electrical power input, including any integrated motor control equipment, at the peak efficiency point and full speed, is greater than 750 W—

ol.xt:author: Jerome Samuel
ol.li: the fan must be capable of variable speed operation; and
where serving a single room or space, the fan must be capable of operating at reduced flow when conditions in the room or space served are within the temperature control deadband; if applicable and

where not serving a single room or space, the fan and the system it serves must—
be capable of variable volume operation; and
operate to a variable pressure to the extent practicable.

subclause.xt:author: Jerome Samuel
subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: The requirements of (2) to (5) do not apply to fans—

ol.xt:author: Jerome Samuel
ol.li: with electrical input power less than or equal to 125 W; or
that need to explosion proof; or
supply fans inside unitary air-conditioning equipment.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Ductwork:The pressure drop in the index run across all straight sections of rigid ductwork and all sections of flexible ductwork must not exceed 1 Pa/m when averaged over the entire length of straight rigid duct and flexible duct. The pressure drop of flexible ductwork sections may be calculated as if the flexible ductwork is laid straight.

subclause.xt:author: Jerome Samuel
subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Flexible ductwork must not account for more than 6 m intotal length in any duct run.

subclause.xt:author: Jerome Samuel
subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: The upstream connection to ductwork bends, elbows and teesfittings in the index run must have an equivalent diameter to the connected duct.

subclause.xt:author: Jerome Samuel
subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Turning vanes must be included in all rigid ductwork elbows of 90° or more acute than 90° in the index run except where—

ol.xt:author: Jerome Samuel
ol.li: the inclusion of turning vanes presents a fouling risk; or
a long radius bend in accordance with AS 4254.2 is used.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: DuctworkFor ductwork components in the index run:

ol.li: Tthe pressure drop across a coil must not exceed the value specified in Table J6D5d.; and

Aa high efficiency particulate arrestance (HEPA) air filter must not exceed the higher of—
a pressure drop of 200 Pa when clean; or
the filter design pressure drop when clean at an air velocity of 1.5 m/s.; and

Aany other air filter must not exceed—
the pressure drop specified in Table J6D5e when clean; or
the filter design pressure drop when clean at an air velocity of 2.5 m/s.; and

Tthe pressure drop across intake louvres, relief louvres and exhaust louvres must not exceed the higher of—
for single stage louvres, 30 Pa; and
for two stage louvres, 60 Pa; and
for acoustic louvres, 50 Pa; and
for other non-weatherproof louvres, 30 Pa.; and

Tthe pressure drop across a variable air volume box, with the damper in the fully open position, must not exceed—
for units with electric reheat, 100 Pa; and
for other units, 25 Pa not including coil pressure losses.; and
Rrooftop cowls must not exceed a pressure drop of 30 Pa.; and
Aattenuators must not exceed a pressure drop of 40 Pa.; and
Ffire dampers must not exceed a pressure drop of 15 Pa when open.; and
Bbalancing and control dampers in the index run must not exceed a pressure drop of 25 Pa when in the fully open position.; and
Ssupply air diffusers and grilles must not exceed a pressure drop of 40 Pa.; and
Eexhaust grilles must not exceed a pressure drop of 30 Pa.; and
Ttransfer ducts must not exceed a pressure drop of 12 Pa.; and
Ddoor grilles and door undercuts must not exceed a pressure drop of 12 Pa.; and
Aactive chilled beams must not exceed a pressure drop of 150 Pa.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: The requirements of (1) to (11), (2), (3) and (4) do not apply to—

ol.li: fans in unducted air-conditioning systems with a supply air capacity of less than 1000 L/s; and
fans which are dedicated solely to fire and smoke controlsmoke spill fans, except where also used for air-conditioning or ventilation; and
the power for process-related components; and
kitchen exhaust systems.

callout.xt:author: Jerome Samuel
callout.p: For the purposes of (1)(b), fan motor input power per unit of flowrate may be calculated for air-conditioning systems and mechanical ventilation systems together.
